skillTree.localised_description: On his deathbed, Wilhelm insisted that he be buried with gold coins pressed into his eye sockets rather than traditional Morrite pennies. For his arrogance, the god of the dead refused to take Wilhelm’s soul into the afterlife.
No man in his army, living or dead, will question this Emperor’s will.

effects.description:
Attribute: Unbreakable for all Heroes
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: The undead are not against accepting the service of mortal men in their legions; this is especially true for the former Emperor, who is accustomed to the living over the shambling corpses.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -25% for all Living units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for all Living units
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Immune to Psychology to all Living units when fighting against the forces of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%

skillTree.localised_description: The spirit of Wilhelm I has haunted the crypts of Altdorf ever since his death, forbidden from the afterlife by Morr.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for all Skeletal units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +12 for all Skeletal units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +18 for all Skeletal units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Like many Emperors before him, Wilhelm was a mighty warrior trained to kill all manner of beasts from a young age. Those lessons remain with him even in death.
Wilhelm is as harsh a ruler as he was in life, levying steep tax rates upon the peasantry.
His ruthless leadership, coupled with his newfound necromantic powers, make Wilhelm a dangerous commander.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +10% for alliances with the Empire
Allegiance points gained: +20% for alliances with the Empire

skillTree.localised_description: The sworn duty of the Emperor is to vanquish the servants of Chaos, and he is certainly not going to break his oath, even as a thrall of Undeath.

effects.description:
Leadership: +15 when fighting against all servants of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

Spell Resistance: +10% when fighting against all servants of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though he inhabits a skeletal body, his soul remains that of a proud ruler from a proud nation.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with all Order races

Upkeep: -50% for all Living units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Emperor has led dozens of battles against the bloated followers of Nurgle, including a recent victory against Putrefex Blistertongue, in which he severed his foe’s grotesque hands and routed his forces.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: -35%
	(armies in local province)

Melee defence: +10 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

Chance of a plague spreading: -60%
	(armies in local province)

Melee defence: +15 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Known for his excessive taxing and brutal dictates, Emperor Wilhelm rules with an iron fist, dominating those who would dare to raise their sword against him.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +25% for alliances with the Empire

Unlocks Hero recruitment: Wight King
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
"I am mighty, none dare challenge me!"

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "Arise my host, my Unliving minions - bring me victory!"

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord of Necromancy's minions do not suffer exhaustion, they can walk for leagues and never suffer.
Once slain in battle, the foe belongs to the Undead Lord, and will rise again, eager to serve.

effects.description: The Dead Rise Again: +5% hit points for destroyed units restored after battle
The Dead Rise Again: +10% hit points for destroyed units restored after battle
The Dead Rise Again: +15% hit points for destroyed units restored after battle

skillTree.localised_description: A powerful, vigorous Lord of Darkness will see the Children of the Night gather unto them.

skillTree.localised_description: The sun is no ally of the dead - a sky scorched black, or darkest night, will invigorate the Unliving.

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Such a beast is all but impossible to destroy - an immortal horror doomed to haunt eternity!

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A simple glamour can disguise a monstrous Vampire or Liche, so they may then charm and beguile the local populace.
W'soran's scions are masters at the art of Necromancy, to dabble in such will be a boon.
This Lord has endless forbearance, a timeless patience crafted over millennia.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord can hear the thoughts of mortals for leagues around, and plan accordingly.

Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +15
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

items.colour_text: A once-glistening crown with a single ruby gem embedded at the front. This was the crown of the ancient Emperor of Reikland. Even in death, Wilhelm still commands some respect and admiration from Reiklanders.

effects.description: Enables passive ability: Crown of the Emperor

items.colour_text: A mighty blade that glows white with a killing heat, this sword has slain countless vile creatures during the former Emperor’s reign.

effects.description: Enables passive ability: Blade of Light

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Wilhelm I was remembered as an arrogant tyrant, but also as a devout worshipper of Sigmar and purifier of the Empire from Chaotic taint.
